    Loader Classes

    The flowerpower-io library provides several loader classes for reading data from various sources and formats. These classes extend the base classes and provide specialized functionality for specific data sources.

    CSV Loader

    CSVLoader

    class CSVLoader(BaseFileReader, gc=False)

    Loader for CSV files.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to CSV file(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "csv"
    include_file_path bool Include file path in the output DataFrame. Default: False
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: True
    batch_size int \| None Batch size for reading data. Default: None
    opt_dtypes bool Optimize data types. Default: False
    use_threads bool Use threads for reading data. Default: True
    conn duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None DuckDB connection instance.
    ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None DataFusion session context instance.
    jsonlines bool \| None Whether the file is in JSON Lines format. Default: False
    partitioning str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    verbose bool \| None Verbose output.
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    csv_options dict[str, Any] Additional CSV reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pandas (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame \| list[pd.DataFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame(s).
    iter_pandas (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pd.DataFrame, None, None] Iterate over Pandas DataFrames.
    to_polars (lazy: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| tuple[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame or LazyFrame.
    iter_polars (lazy: bool = False, reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame, None, None] Iterate over Polars DataFrames or LazyFrames.
    to_pyarrow_table (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| list[pa.Table] \| tuple[pa.Table \| list[pa.Table], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table(s).
    iter_pyarrow_table (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pa.Table, None, None] Iterate over PyArrow Tables.
    to_duckdb_relation (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DuckDB.
    to_duckdb (as_relation: bool = True, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation or register in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> datafusion.SessionContext \| tuple[datafusion.SessionContext, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DataFusion.
    filter (filter_expr: str \| pl.Expr \| pa.compute.Expression) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| list[pa.Table] Filter data based on a filter expression.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.loader import CSVLoader

# Initialize CSV loader
loader = CSVLoader(
    path="data/*.csv",
    include_file_path=True,
    concat=True
)

# Convert to different formats
df_pandas = loader.to_pandas()
df_polars = loader.to_polars()
table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="my_table")

    Parquet Loader

    ParquetLoader

    class ParquetLoader(BaseDatasetReader, gc=False)

    Loader for Parquet files.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to Parquet file(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "parquet"
    include_file_path bool Include file path in the output DataFrame. Default: False
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: True
    batch_size int \| None Batch size for reading data. Default: None
    opt_dtypes bool Optimize data types. Default: False
    use_threads bool Use threads for reading data. Default: True
    conn duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None DuckDB connection instance.
    ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None DataFusion session context instance.
    jsonlines bool \| None Whether the file is in JSON Lines format. Default: False
    partitioning str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    verbose bool \| None Verbose output.
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    _dataset pds.Dataset \| None Internal PyArrow dataset.
    _pydala_dataset Any \| None Internal Pydala dataset.
    pydala bool Use Pydala for reading. Default: False

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pandas (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame \| list[pd.DataFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame(s).
    iter_pandas (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pd.DataFrame, None, None] Iterate over Pandas DataFrames.
    to_polars (lazy: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| tuple[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame or LazyFrame.
    iter_polars (lazy: bool = False, reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame, None, None] Iterate over Polars DataFrames or LazyFrames.
    to_pyarrow_table (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| list[pa.Table] \| tuple[pa.Table \| list[pa.Table], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table(s).
    iter_pyarrow_table (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pa.Table, None, None] Iterate over PyArrow Tables.
    to_duckdb_relation (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DuckDB.
    to_duckdb (as_relation: bool = True, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation or register in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> datafusion.SessionContext \| tuple[datafusion.SessionContext, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DataFusion.
    filter (filter_expr: str \| pl.Expr \| pa.compute.Expression) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| list[pa.Table] Filter data based on a filter expression.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.
    to_pyarrow_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pds.Dataset \| tuple[pds.Dataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Dataset.
    to_pydala_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> ParquetDataset \| tuple[ParquetDataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pydala ParquetDataset.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.loader import ParquetLoader

# Initialize Parquet loader
loader = ParquetLoader(
    path="data/*.parquet",
    include_file_path=True,
    concat=True
)

# Convert to different formats
df_pandas = loader.to_pandas()
df_polars = loader.to_polars()
table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()
dataset = loader.to_pyarrow_dataset()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="my_table")

    JSON Loader

    JSONLoader

    class JSONLoader(BaseFileReader, gc=False)

    Loader for JSON files.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to JSON file(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "json"
    include_file_path bool Include file path in the output DataFrame. Default: False
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: True
    batch_size int \| None Batch size for reading data. Default: None
    opt_dtypes bool Optimize data types. Default: False
    use_threads bool Use threads for reading data. Default: True
    conn duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None DuckDB connection instance.
    ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None DataFusion session context instance.
    jsonlines bool \| None Whether the file is in JSON Lines format. Default: False
    partitioning str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    verbose bool \| None Verbose output.
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    json_options dict[str, Any] Additional JSON reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pandas (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame \| list[pd.DataFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame(s).
    iter_pandas (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pd.DataFrame, None, None] Iterate over Pandas DataFrames.
    to_polars (lazy: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| tuple[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame or LazyFrame.
    iter_polars (lazy: bool = False, reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame, None, None] Iterate over Polars DataFrames or LazyFrames.
    to_pyarrow_table (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| list[pa.Table] \| tuple[pa.Table \| list[pa.Table], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table(s).
    iter_pyarrow_table (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pa.Table, None, None] Iterate over PyArrow Tables.
    to_duckdb_relation (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DuckDB.
    to_duckdb (as_relation: bool = True, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation or register in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> datafusion.SessionContext \| tuple[datafusion.SessionContext, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DataFusion.
    filter (filter_expr: str \| pl.Expr \| pa.compute.Expression) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| list[pa.Table] Filter data based on a filter expression.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.loader import JSONLoader

# Initialize JSON loader
loader = JSONLoader(
    path="data/*.json",
    include_file_path=True,
    concat=True
)

# Convert to different formats
df_pandas = loader.to_pandas()
df_polars = loader.to_polars()
table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="my_table")

    DeltaTable Loader

    DeltaTableLoader

    class DeltaTableLoader(BaseDatasetReader, gc=False)

    Loader for Delta Lake tables.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to Delta Lake table(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "deltatable"
    include_file_path bool Include file path in the output DataFrame. Default: False
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: True
    batch_size int \| None Batch size for reading data. Default: None
    opt_dtypes bool Optimize data types. Default: False
    use_threads bool Use threads for reading data. Default: True
    conn duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None DuckDB connection instance.
    ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None DataFusion session context instance.
    jsonlines bool \| None Whether the file is in JSON Lines format. Default: False
    partitioning str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    verbose bool \| None Verbose output.
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    _dataset pds.Dataset \| None Internal PyArrow dataset.
    _pydala_dataset Any \| None Internal Pydala dataset.
    delta_options dict[str, Any] Additional Delta Lake reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pandas (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame \| list[pd.DataFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame(s).
    iter_pandas (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pd.DataFrame, None, None] Iterate over Pandas DataFrames.
    to_polars (lazy: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| tuple[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame or LazyFrame.
    iter_polars (lazy: bool = False, reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame, None, None] Iterate over Polars DataFrames or LazyFrames.
    to_pyarrow_table (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| list[pa.Table] \| tuple[pa.Table \| list[pa.Table], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table(s).
    iter_pyarrow_table (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pa.Table, None, None] Iterate over PyArrow Tables.
    to_duckdb_relation (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DuckDB.
    to_duckdb (as_relation: bool = True, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation or register in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> datafusion.SessionContext \| tuple[datafusion.SessionContext, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DataFusion.
    filter (filter_expr: str \| pl.Expr \| pa.compute.Expression) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| list[pa.Table] Filter data based on a filter expression.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.
    to_pyarrow_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pds.Dataset \| tuple[pds.Dataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Dataset.
    to_pydala_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> ParquetDataset \| tuple[ParquetDataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pydala ParquetDataset.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.loader import DeltaTableLoader

# Initialize DeltaTable loader
loader = DeltaTableLoader(
    path="delta_table/",
    include_file_path=True,
    concat=True
)

# Convert to different formats
df_pandas = loader.to_pandas()
df_polars = loader.to_polars()
table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()
dataset = loader.to_pyarrow_dataset()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="my_table")

    Pydala Loader

    PydalaLoader

    class PydalaLoader(BaseDatasetReader, gc=False)

    Loader for Pydala datasets.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to Pydala dataset(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "pydala"
    include_file_path bool Include file path in the output DataFrame. Default: False
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: True
    batch_size int \| None Batch size for reading data. Default: None
    opt_dtypes bool Optimize data types. Default: False
    use_threads bool Use threads for reading data. Default: True
    conn duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None DuckDB connection instance.
    ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None DataFusion session context instance.
    jsonlines bool \| None Whether the file is in JSON Lines format. Default: False
    partitioning str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    verbose bool \| None Verbose output.
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    _dataset pds.Dataset \| None Internal PyArrow dataset.
    _pydala_dataset Any \| None Internal Pydala dataset.
    pydala_options dict[str, Any] Additional Pydala reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pandas (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame \| list[pd.DataFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame(s).
    iter_pandas (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pd.DataFrame, None, None] Iterate over Pandas DataFrames.
    to_polars (lazy: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| tuple[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame or LazyFrame.
    iter_polars (lazy: bool = False, reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame, None, None] Iterate over Polars DataFrames or LazyFrames.
    to_pyarrow_table (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| list[pa.Table] \| tuple[pa.Table \| list[pa.Table], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table(s).
    iter_pyarrow_table (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pa.Table, None, None] Iterate over PyArrow Tables.
    to_duckdb_relation (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DuckDB.
    to_duckdb (as_relation: bool = True, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation or register in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> datafusion.SessionContext \| tuple[datafusion.SessionContext, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DataFusion.
    filter (filter_expr: str \| pl.Expr \| pa.compute.Expression) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| list[pa.Table] Filter data based on a filter expression.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.
    to_pyarrow_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pds.Dataset \| tuple[pds.Dataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Dataset.
    to_pydala_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> ParquetDataset \| tuple[ParquetDataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pydala ParquetDataset.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.loader import PydalaLoader

# Initialize Pydala loader
loader = PydalaLoader(
    path="pydala_dataset/",
    include_file_path=True,
    concat=True
)

# Convert to different formats
df_pandas = loader.to_pandas()
df_polars = loader.to_polars()
table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()
dataset = loader.to_pyarrow_dataset()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="my_table")

    MQTT Loader

    MQTTLoader

    class MQTTLoader(BaseFileReader, gc=False)

    Loader for MQTT messages.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] MQTT topic(s) to subscribe to.
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None MQTT connection options.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "mqtt"
    include_file_path bool Include file path in the output DataFrame. Default: False
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: True
    batch_size int \| None Batch size for reading data. Default: None
    opt_dtypes bool Optimize data types. Default: False
    use_threads bool Use threads for reading data. Default: True
    conn duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None DuckDB connection instance.
    ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None DataFusion session context instance.
    jsonlines bool \| None Whether the file is in JSON Lines format. Default: False
    partitioning str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    verbose bool \| None Verbose output.
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    mqtt_options dict[str, Any] Additional MQTT reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pandas (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame \| list[pd.DataFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame(s).

    to_polars (lazy: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| tuple[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame or LazyFrame.
    iter_polars (lazy: bool = False, reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame, None, None] Iterate over Polars DataFrames or LazyFrames.
    to_pyarrow_table (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| list[pa.Table] \| tuple[pa.Table \| list[pa.Table], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table(s).

    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.loader import MQTTLoader

# Initialize MQTT loader
loader = MQTTLoader(
    path="sensors/temperature",
    storage_options={
        "host": "mqtt.example.com",
        "port": 1883,
        "username": "user",
        "password": "password"
    }
)

# Convert to different formats
df_pandas = loader.to_pandas()
df_polars = loader.to_polars()
table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="temperature_data")

    Database Loaders

    SQLiteLoader

    class SQLiteLoader(BaseDatabaseReader, gc=False)

    Loader for SQLite databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "sqlite"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite database.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    query str \| None SQL query to execute.
    sqlite_options dict[str, Any] Additional SQLite reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_polars (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| tuple[pl.DataFrame, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame.
    to_pandas (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame.
    to_pyarrow_table (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| tuple[pa.Table, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table.
    to_duckdb_relation (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> None Register data in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> None Register data in DataFusion.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.loader import SQLiteLoader

# Initialize SQLite loader
loader = SQLiteLoader(
    type_="sqlite",
    table_name="users",
    path="database.db"
)

# Convert to different formats
df_polars = loader.to_polars()
df_pandas = loader.to_pandas()
table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="users")

    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.

    database str \| None Database name.

    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.

    duckdb_options dict[str, Any] Additional DuckDB reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description

    register_in_datafusion (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> None Register data in DataFusion.

    table_name="users",
    path="database.db"
)

    host="localhost",
    username="user",
    password="password",

    OracleLoader

    class OracleLoader(BaseDatabaseReader, gc=False)

    Loader for Oracle databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "oracle"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite or DuckDB databases.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    query str \| None SQL query to execute.
    oracle_options dict[str, Any] Additional Oracle reader options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_polars (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| tuple[pl.DataFrame, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame.
    to_pandas (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame.
    to_pyarrow_table (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| tuple[pa.Table, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table.
    to_duckdb_relation (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> None Register data in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> None Register data in DataFusion.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.

    Example

    ```python from flowerpower_io.loader import OracleLoader

    Initialize Oracle loader

    loader = OracleLoader( type_="oracle", table_name="users", host="localhost", username="user", password="password", database="mydb" )

    Convert to different formats

    df_polars = loader.to_polars() df_pandas = loader.to_pandas() table_arrow = loader.to_pyarrow_table()

    Register in DuckDB

    conn = loader.register_in_duckdb(name="users")
